meanings.definition: Sullen or sulky in mood or disposition.
meanings.sent1: After losing the game, Timmy was grum and didn't want to talk to anyone.
meanings.sent2: The grum cat sat in the corner, refusing to be petted.
meanings.sent3: Even the sunshine couldn't cheer up the grum bear in the zoo.
meanings.sent4: Her grum expression was like a dark cloud hanging over the party.
meanings.sent5: The grum clouds matched his gloomy mood perfectly.

meanings.sent1: She would always grum about having to do chores around the house.
meanings.sent2: The old man would grum about the weather every morning.
meanings.sent3: Don't grum too much, or you'll miss out on all the fun!
meanings.sent4: The engine grummed loudly as the car struggled up the hill.
meanings.sent5: His constant grumming was like a broken record playing in the background.

meanings.sent1: The distant grum of thunder signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The grum of the coffee machine in the morning was a comforting sound.
meanings.sent3: The grum of the old pipes in the house made it feel alive.
meanings.sent4: The grum of the crowd grew louder as the concert began.
meanings.sent5: The grum of the engine was music to his ears as he revved it up.
